body: @jkff I updated the PR with a `AmqpMessage` which is a wrapper of `Message` in order to provide `equals()` method (required by the `MutationDetector` to check if there's no mutation in the elements of a `PCollection`).
@jkff I think the PR is ready for a new review round.

Can you please rebase (to fix the conflict) ?

It is easy to run a full production `ValidatesRunner` suite in streaming mode. We simply have a bit of a bikeshed on the Jenkins setup for it. Have you run it manually? I would like this in addition to local testing. I'm fine if you use `-Dtest=...` to limit to relevant tests.

- Just moves how this is defined. My understanding from playing around on my own jenkins is that the A-D view is comprised of other views defined on Jenkins; I wasn't able to find a way to define this view in the context of the A-D view.
- Will do
- My philosophy on this is launch and iterate -- want to make sure we're generating the basic view correctly (control number of things changing), then evaluate fancier options.
LGTM

@kennknowles I'm a bit confused what you're asking: the current PR has been tested using `ValidatesRunner` tests - just that its `ValidatesRunner` tests explicitly force to execute themselves in streaming mode (create a `TestPipeline` with `options.setStreaming(true)`) - so the PR will have continuous test coverage, it's just implemented a bit ickily.

I've also run these tests in IntelliJ against production Dataflow service with the options passed by the `Dataflow ValidatesRunner` profile (but different project cause I don't have access to `apache-beam-testing`) plus `--streaming`. Is this sufficient or are you asking for something else?
Taking a look at this later today.

AIs here:
- Break into two commits at least -- alphabetization in the first, versioning fixes in the second.
- Create different sections for plugin and dependency versions (investigate whether this will be an actual XML separation or just comment blocks).

Dan's comment about the comments is I believe moot here -- the two numbers which had to be kept in sync are now just controlled by one version property, eliminating the possibility of becoming out of sync.

R: @xumingming 
can you also take a peak here?
R: @ssisk
@takidau could you merge it if no pending changes?
Retest this please

The latter paragraph is what I was asking for. I think the first paragraph is good motivation to just get the Jenkins coverage in, otherwise those hacks will likely be forgotten and remain for a long time.
LGTM, after branch conflict fixes.

Running Jenkins against first commit here: https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/12512/

If it passes, the commit seems good.

Any updates? IMHO, without parquet, batch mode (and/or spark runner) is mostly impractical. However, with parquet, Cloud Storage (as data lake) and DataFlow( with the new Apache Beam SQL DSL) could be a great combo.

@jkff I updated according to your comments. Especially, I changed:
- directly use ProtonJ `Message` in `PCollection`
- simplify `WriteFn`to use address and subject defined in the message elements of the `PCollection`
- change the watermark to the message creation date
This PR is ready for a new review round. Thanks !
Also very interested in this PR, look forward to more updates!
I'm on the top of my TODO for the following days (I just updated `AmqpIO`). Stay tuned !

By the way, I splitted this PR in smaller chunk to simplify the review. The first part is the Redis store read: https://github.com/jbonofre/beam/pull/3

I'm updating right now to test with an embedded Redis instance.
